snippet: A new study suggests that biologists don’t really know enough about the grizzly population to take the animals off the endangered list.
abstract: Editorial cites study published in journal Conservation Letters that calls into question claim by Fish and Wildlife Service that some 700 grizzly bears live in greater Yellowstone ecosystem; urges agency to pay close attention to criticisms of its bear count and bear management plan; disputes wisdom of removing species from federal protection.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that biologists don’t really know enough about the grizzly population to take the animals off the endangered list.
